item.title: On Tuesday, March 16 at around 5:00 p.m., three spas staffed by...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

On Tuesday, March 16 at around 5:00 p.m., three spas staffed by Asian workers in the Atlanta area were the targets of a racist and sexist mass shooting. Eight people were killed, seven of whom were women, and six of the women were Asian. The shooter, a 21 year old white male, admitted to this heinous crime shortly after he was arrested later that night. Atlanta residents and Asian Americans across the country are horrified by this egregious act of terror.

The Party for Socia...

Continue ReadingPhoto: Demonstration last weekend in Los Angeles against the rising tide of anti-Asian hate crimes On Tuesday, March 16 at around 5:00 p.m., three spas staffed by Asian workers in the Atlanta area were the targets of a racist and sexist mass shooting. Eight... #antiAsianracism #imperialism #racism

liberationnews.org

item.title: 8 people were murdered in the Atlanta area on the night of March...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

8 people were murdered in the Atlanta area on the night of March 16 when a white supremacist carried out a series of terrorist attacks targeting spas staffed by Asian workers. The Party for Socialism and Liberation expresses our deepest sympathy and solidarity to the loved ones of those who lost their lives in these horrific massacres.

The following article was originally published March 7, and analyzes the roots of the wave of anti-Asian hate sweeping the country. https://www.liberationnews.org/why-are-hate-crimes-against…/
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Mumia Abu-Jamal has COVID! We demand that Governor Tom Wolf...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Mumia Abu-Jamal has COVID! We demand that Governor Tom Wolf Larry Krasner for DA Pennsylvania Department of Corrections provide Mumia IMMEDIATE hospital care & issue his release NOW! Barring Mumia from medical attention & his FREEDOM is a human rights atrocity and a public health catastrophe. We demand justice and will not stand for anything less!

Take action NOW by calling PA Governor Tom Wolf's office EVERY DAY at (717) 787-2500 to demand humane treatment and compassionate ...release of Mumia Abu-Jamal, a political prisoner with COVID19 and pre-existing conditions. The time to release all aging and ill prisoners is NOW.

➡️ Phone script in comments

#FreeMumia #FreeEmAll #COVID19 #FreeAllPoliticalPrisoners

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in DenverToday Lillian House, Joel Northam and Eliza Lucero head...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in Denver

Today Lillian House, Joel Northam and Eliza Lucero head to preliminary hearing.

The officers who killed Elijah McClain walk free while the activists who demande...d justice must defend their rights in court. They face as many as 48 years in prison for leading peaceful protests for justice for Elijah McClain. The most extreme charges they face come from the same district attorney who let Elijah’s killers walk.

#DroptheChargesCO

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: "There are still separate justice systems in America,"...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"There are still separate justice systems in America," says the Root.

"The officers involved in [Elijah] McClain’s fatal arrest—Nathan Woodyard, Jason Rosenblatt and Randy Roedema—are still employed with the Aurora Police Department, after former Adams County District Attorney Dave Young said they did not break the law in their use of force against McClain. Protests against the lack of accountability for the cops went into overdrive in Aurora last summer amidst the nationwide... outrage against police brutality, especially when it came to light that police officers there had taken mocking selfies outside of a memorial to McClain.

Now several of the organizers who led those protests are potentially facing decades in prison on a suite of charges filed by Young before he left office.

“I think about the fact that we’ve done more jail time and have faced more consequences just for asking for justice for a man who we saw murdered on video, than any of the cops,” said Northam."

See MoreThere are still separate justice systems in America, as has been evidenced by the continuing dearth of criminal consequences for police officers who’ve caused the death of numerous Americans—even in light of last year’s uprisings against high-profile cases of police violence.

theroot.com

Elijah McClain Organizers Facing Attempted Kidnapping Charges and Decades of Prison Time for Protesting Aurora, Colo., Police

There are still separate justice systems in America, as has been evidenced by the continuing dearth of criminal consequences for police officers who’ve caused the death of numerous Americans—even in light of last year’s uprisings against high-profile cases of police violence.There are still separate justice systems in America, as has been evidenced by the continuing dearth of criminal consequences for police officers who’ve caused the death of numerous Americans—even in light of last year’s uprisings against high-profile cases of police violence.

item.title: While Colorado’s billionaires have made billions more, the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

While Colorado’s billionaires have made billions more, the rest of us are in the middle of an economic crisis. As food banks run out of food, a third of us can’t afford to eat. A third of renters are at risk of eviction. Many of us can’t afford diapers for our children. Our state and federal government have given us crumbs in the face of these humanitarian crises.

We live in the richest country history has ever seen, yet we are left to starve in the cold while a select few hoard more and more wealth. The rich and their politicians in Colorado and across the country are waging a war on the working people of this country, and we have to organize to fight back. Join us as we demand the cancellation of rents and mortgages, and a right to food, housing, a job, and healthcare!
https://www.denverpost.com/…/covid-colorado-economic-inequ…/

Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.

denverpost.com

As job, housing and pay inequalities worsen, Coloradans say mantra to “build back stronger” rings hollow

Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.

item.title: Celebrate International Women's Day with this Breaking the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Celebrate International Women's Day with this Breaking the Chains x PSL event tonight at 6MT! Working Women Lead the Way

The webinar event features an incredible array of women revolutionaries speaking about their experiences on the frontlines of a diverse range of struggles and how we build for a future free from exploitation, subjugation, and oppression. Look for Denver PSL's Lillian House!

item.title: Live now!
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Live now!

National Committee for Justice in Denver was live.

Civil rights attorneys and movement leaders speak out against the dangerous political prosecution of the leaders of the peaceful protest movement for justice fo...r Elijah McClain!

Hear from:

Heidi Boghosian
-Constitutional & civil rights attorney
-Executive Director of the NY-based AJ Muste Institute
-Former Executive Director of the National Lawyers Guild

Kerbie Joseph
-NY-based anti-police brutality activist
-Political prisoner advocate
-Program coordinator of the Audre Lorde Project

Mara Verheyden-Hilliard
-Constitutional & civil rights attorney
-Founder of the DC-based Partnership for Civil Justice Fund

Joel Northam and Lillian House, leaders of the Elijah McClain protests now facing 42 and 48 years in prison respectively

Amelia Power, one of the attorneys representing the targeted organizers

item.title: Important coverage from Denver Westword shedding light on the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Important coverage from Denver Westword shedding light on the connection between the progress made in Elijah McClain’s case and the retaliatory and baseless charges against the organizers who have been at the forefront of the mass movement demanding justice.

PSL organizers Lillian House, Joel Northam, and Eliza Lucero, and Terrance Roberts of the Frontline Party for Revolutionary Action, lead organizers of the mass peaceful protests for #justiceforElijahMcClain, are all currently fighting a political prosecution that could put them in prison for as many as 48 years.

They've been charged. The officers involved in his death have not.

westword.com

Leaders of Justice for Elijah McClain Protests Headed to Court March 1

They've been charged. The officers involved in his death have not.They've been charged. The officers involved in his death have not.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Today, we held a car protest calling on Governor Jared Polis to...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today, we held a car protest calling on Governor Jared Polis to stop the coming wave of mass evictions and CANCEL RENTS & MORTGAGES! Coloradans, like people everywhere in the country, are suffering under the staggering weight of a year of extreme crisis. Over 15% of the state's population may face eviction in the coming months without REAL relief policies.

We demand:
1) Cancel rents and mortgages
2) No evictions...
3) No foreclosures
4)Full housing rights and relief for undocumented people
5)Homes for the homeless

Thank you to our cohosts Denver DSA, Sanctuary4All Colorado, Denver Homeless Out Loud, and 9to5 Colorado!

See More+31
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: RELEASE MUMIA NOW!
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

RELEASE MUMIA NOW!

+5Party for Socialism and Liberation - Philly

Political prisoner Mumia Abu-Jamal has COVID!

Mobilizing at a moment’s notice, his supporters including PSL members gathered in front of the District Attorney’...s office to demand that Mumia receive adequate medical treatment in a hospital and to keep up the fight for his release from prison. Conditions for all prisoners amid the pandemic are terrible, and tragically but predictably have led to mass outbreaks of the disease. This would not be the first time that prison authorities attempt to kill Mumia through medical neglect, but the people can stop them!

See More

item.title: Watch the powerful short documentary film about the activists...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Watch the powerful short documentary film about the activists facing decades in prison for leading peaceful protests for #JusticeforElijahMcClain

Visit DenverDefense.org to donate, sign the petition to #DroptheChargesCO, and learn how else you can support.

BreakThrough News

The only people charged over the brutal police murder of Elijah McClain are community activists who organized mass peaceful demonstrations calling for justice. ...They are facing up to 48 years in prison - among the highest charges for peaceful political protest in recent history.

Watch our documentary 'In Defense of Justice in Denver' Now:

#JusticeForElijahMcClain #DropTheChargesCO
